snippet.title: The Peace of Wild Things | Sean Ivory
snippet.description:
The Peace of Wild Things composed by Sean Ivory for SSAA choirs with piano and viola accompaniment (parts included).

https://www.giamusic.com/store/resour...

While many settings of this Wendell Berry text exists, perhaps none capture its essence as beautifully as this work by Sean Ivory. With expertly crafted vocal lines, an artistic and supportive piano accompaniment, and a stunning viola part, this work for more advanced treble choirs will become a standard in the treble repertoire.

The Peace of Wild Things

When despair for the world grows in me 
and I wake in the night at the least sound 
in fear of what my life and my children’s lives may be, 
I go and lie down where the wood drake 
rests in his beauty on the water, and the great heron feeds. 
I come into the peace of wild things 
who do not tax their lives with forethought 
of grief. I come into the presence of still water. 
And I feel above me the day-blind stars 
waiting with their light. For a time 
I rest in the grace of the world, and am free.

#WaltonMusic #Choir #Choral
